item.description: There are several ways to stay persistent on a Windows machine. One of them is to set up the program to be automatically started at a certain time (most often - at system startup).

SOFTWARE hive also has Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\Run and Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\Winlogon\Userinit (contains reference to the userinit.

item.title: FAT
item.description: Any FAT partition has two main parts: system area and data area. System area contains FAT boot record (every file system has a boot record), 1st FAT and 2nd FAT.

item.title: Windows IPC
item.description: COM (Component Object Model) objects are a way to let processes call other processes. A process, that needs to call someone else loads a COM.dll into it’s address space.

item.title: Windows Core Processes
item.description: There are two broad categories of Windows core processes. Processes that initialize system environment and those that initialize the user environment. Whatever is the category, you need to know them well in order to detect abnormal things.

item.title: üîê Windows Authentication
item.description: Each process in the system has an access token. This token determies what privileges this fellow has.
